column4: is there any problem with drivers for nVidia FX5200? cause i tried to install them last time and it worked for a day or two an then my computer screen went black and i had to reinstall ubuntu...
I have that GPU, and I spent forever fixiing it, just got it working
with that being said
Is there anything wrong right now?
Have you tried sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-net (Thats what just made my card start working)
You could, worst comes to worst, you get thrown to a Shell with no GUI, which is where I was, but you could just reinstall default drivers
it said "couldnt find package"
I forgot, first do "sudo apt-get remove nvidia-glx"
it said "package not installed so not removed"
Okay, thats good, we didn't want it anyway :D Now be sure you type this exactly (without the quotes) "sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-new"
its installing now
oh, ok :D
downloading and installing now... after that just do a restart and thats it?
there is another command
I need to remember it, but don't restart
ok, done... installed, what now?
nvidia-xconfig enable
Yeah, that wasn't the right one
should i wait for somethin... ?
sudo nvidia-xconfig
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg and choose nvidia as the driver
nvidia
wait for gnomefreak's help :D
He has this down more than mo
